meanings.definition: A pipe with a valve and spout for drawing water from a main pipe in case of fire.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter quickly connected the hose to the hydrant to put out the blazing building.
meanings.sent2: I turned the hydrant to get some water for my thirsty dog.
meanings.sent3: The hydrant seemed to wink at me as if saying, 'I'm here to save the day!'
meanings.sent4: She saw the hydrant as a hero, ready to rescue the town from any fiery danger.
meanings.sent5: The bright red hydrant stood out like a beacon of safety on the street corner.
